title: Color change in iron III thiocyanate

content.question:
<math alttext="F e with a positive 3 charge aqueous colorless plus S C N with a negative 1 charge aqueous colorless is in equilibrium with F e S C N with a positive 2 charge aqueous red brown" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msup><mrow><mtext>Fe</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext>colorless</mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable><mtable><mtr><mtd><mo>+</mo></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext> </mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable><mtable><mtr><mtd><msup><mrow><mtext>SCN</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext>colorless</mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable><mtable><mtr><mtd><mo>⇄</mo></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext> </mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable><mtable><mtr><mtd><msup><mrow><mtext>FeSCN</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext>red-brown</mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></math>
The formation of <math alttext="F e S C N with a positive 2 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>FeSCN</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> in an aqueous solution is represented by the chemical equilibrium shown above. A light red-brown solution is prepared combining <math alttext="12.50 milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12.50</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="0.5 molar F e, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><msub><mrow><msub><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Fe(NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> , <math alttext="0. 5 milliliter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="0.002 molar K S C N" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.002</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>KSCN</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="37.0 milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>37.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of water that had been slightly acidified. If an additional <math alttext="1.0 milliliter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="0.5 molar F e, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><msub><mrow><msub><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Fe(NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is added, which of the following predicts and explains correctly whether the darkness of the color of the solution will change?

choices.label: The color of the solution will lighten because most of the volume added is solvent.

The color of the solution will darken because the equilibrium will favor the dissociation of <math alttext="F e S C N with a positive 2 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>FeSCN</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The color of the solution will darken because the equilibrium will favor the formation of more <math alttext="F e S C N with a positive 2 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>FeSCN</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The color of the solution will not change because the solution already contains <math alttext="F e with a positive 3 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Fe</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions.

content.answer: The color of the solution will darken because the equilibrium will favor the formation of more <math alttext="F e S C N with a positive 2 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>FeSCN</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 6.F: Explain the connection between experimental results and chemical concepts, processes, or theories.
